column5: There is some flooding all over the province of Quebec and Hydro-Quebec just release the news that the reservoirs Cabonga, Dozois, Decelles & Baskatong are at full capacity so they will have some though decisions to take. If they open the dams there will be terrible flooding in the south.

I hope they can manage the situation. Many times my group has made the beautiful ride north along the Gatineau River. We have seen the reservoirs in the drawdown stage but never the opposite of too much water. Give an update of the situation as it progresses.
http://ottawacitizen.com/news/local-...gin-in-earnestHope for the best for our neighbors to the north.
A speaker from Hydro-Quebec just give a update on the situation and it seems that they have some room for more waters on the big reservoirs; good news for the people in the south.
